sentences.sContent: So the battery found a captive was gone.
sentences.sContent_eng: So the battery found a captive was gone.
sentences.sCn: 很快，炮兵连发现一名俘虏逃跑了。

sentences.sContent: Ah, thou hast made my heart captive in the endless meshes of thy music, my master!
sentences.sContent_eng: Ah, thou hast made my heart captive in the endless meshes of thy music, my master!
sentences.sCn: 呵，你使我的心变成了你的音乐的漫天大网中的俘虏，我的主人！

sentences.sContent: During his six years in Ireland as a captive, he became deeply religious When he returned to England he became a priest.
sentences.sContent_eng: During his six years in Ireland as a captive, he became deeply religious When he returned to England he became a priest.
sentences.sCn: 就在他在爱尔兰作俘虏的六年里，他深受宗教的洗礼，回到英国成为了一个牧师。

phrases.pCn: 受制而走不开的听众或观众

remMethod.val: capt(抓) + ive(…的) → 被俘虏的 → 俘虏

trans.tranOther: someone who is kept as a prisoner, especially in a war
